Rwandan borders to remain closed till further notice
International tourists to enter Rwanda with charter flights as it reopened tourism activities.

National parks, airport staff to take regular Covid-19 tests in Rwanda

description: Public Officials in Rwanda forfeit their April salaries to support Rwandans in lock down in a show of Solidarity
type_text: This is a move that will raise money that will go a long way to  support the government's food distribution policy to Rwandans under lockdown.It is a show of solidarity by the officials to their fellow rwandan citizens

description: Rwanda Education Board  identifies more than 100 radio scripts from around the world focusing on basic literacy and numeracy that could be adapted to align with Rwanda’s school curriculum to ensure continued learning as schools remain closed till September.
type_text: The scripts for children class lessons are broadcast on FM stations including Rwanda Broadcasting Agency, KT Radio, Radio Maria Rwanda, and Radio Inkoramutima to reach many children around the country.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Construction projects and manufacturing has been given the go-ahead to resume works in Rwanda
type_text: Construction projects and manufacturing has been given the go-ahead to resume works. However, with only essential staff and ensuring the protection of workers

description: In Rwanda as from 04 May 2020, Individual sporting activities allowed, gyms to remain closed
type_text: Fitness enthusiasts will from Monday, May 4, have the liberty to carry out individual sporting activities in open spaces between  5 a.m., and 8 p.m. However, gyms and other recreation/sporting facilities will remain closed.

description: A team of Rwandan developers backed by investors from the UK and US have developed an electronic learning platform,Homeskul ,that seeks to connect teachers and students
type_text: Homeskul is an e-learning portal that connects experienced teachers to parents who are busy to homeschool their children.The platform was developed to respond to the learning needs of students and teachers who have been left with nowhere to go with schools now closed in Rwanda
